descriptions: The student demonstrates no understanding of basic statistical concepts such as mean, median, mode, and standard deviation.
The student shows a limited understanding of basic statistical concepts and struggles to define or differentiate between them.
The student can identify basic statistical concepts but has difficulty applying them in simple scenarios.
The student can define and apply basic statistical concepts in straightforward situations but struggles with more complex applications.
The student demonstrates a solid understanding of statistical concepts and can apply them effectively in various scenarios.
The student exhibits a comprehensive understanding of statistical concepts and can apply them adeptly in complex and novel situations, demonstrating a mastery of the fundamental principles.
The student does not understand the concept of a sampling distribution.
The student shows minimal understanding of sampling distributions and is unable to explain their purpose.
The student can define a sampling distribution but cannot explain its significance in statistical inference.
The student understands the concept of a sampling distribution and its role in statistical inference but has difficulty interpreting it.
The student can interpret and explain the importance of a sampling distribution in making inferences about a population.

The student demonstrates a deep understanding of sampling distributions and can use them to make accurate and well-supported inferences about populations, showcasing a sophisticated grasp of statistical reasoning.
The student is unaware of the concept of variability in statistics.
The student has a limited understanding of variability and cannot explain its impact on statistical analysis.
The student can identify variability in a dataset but struggles to quantify or interpret it.
The student can measure and describe variability but has difficulty relating it to the reliability of statistical estimates.
The student understands the relationship between variability and the reliability of statistical estimates and can account for it in their analysis.

The student demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of variability and can use it to assess the robustness of statistical conclusions, demonstrating a nuanced appreciation of statistical uncertainty.
